## Section 14. Enhanced Medical Benefits

### Benefit A. Additional Hospital & Surgical Expenses
The Annual Sub-Limit under Section 2, Hospital Surgical Expenses Benefit shall be increased by the Benefit Limit as specified in the Policy Schedule.

Co-payment of 25% by You will be applicable if Your Maid is covered under the Basic Plan Type.

If Section 14, Benefit A is included into the Policy after the Effective Date, there will be a Waiting Period of thirty (30) days from the Effective Date as indicated in the Endorsement Letter.

### Benefit B. Critical Illness
If Your Maid within the Period of Insurance have been unequivocally diagnosed as suffering from any one (1) of the five (5) Critical Illness as defined in clause (i) in this Section 14, Benefit B by a Registered Medical Practitioner and has survived thirty (30) days from the date of confirmed diagnosis, We will pay the Benefit Limit as specified in the Policy Schedule.
questions: How does the co-payment requirement of 25% under Benefit A apply when the Maid is covered under the Basic Plan Type, and how does this interact with the increased Annual Sub-Limit for Hospital Surgical Expenses?

What are the implications of adding Section 14, Benefit A after the Policy Effective Date, specifically regarding the 30-day Waiting Period and how it affects claim eligibility for Additional Hospital & Surgical Expenses?

In the event that the Maid is diagnosed with one of the five Critical Illnesses under Benefit B, what conditions must be met regarding the diagnosis and survival period before the Benefit Limit is payable?

How does the definition of the five Critical Illnesses in Section 14, Benefit B influence the scope of coverage, and what documentation is required from a Registered Medical Practitioner to support a claim?

If the Maid is covered under the Basic Plan Type and incurs hospital surgical expenses, how does the 25% co-payment affect the total reimbursable amount given the increased Annual Sub-Limit under Benefit A?
What is the relationship between the Policy Schedule's specified Benefit Limit and the Annual Sub-Limit increase under Benefit A for hospital and surgical expenses?
How does the 30-day survival requirement after diagnosis under Benefit B affect claims for Critical Illness, and what happens if the Maid does not survive this period?
When Section 14, Benefit A is added mid-policy, how does the Waiting Period interact with any pre-existing hospital or surgical expenses incurred before the 30 days have elapsed?
Are there any exclusions or limitations implied by the co-payment clause in Benefit A for Maids covered under the Basic Plan Type, and how might this affect claim outcomes?
How does the timing of the Effective Date and the issuance of the Endorsement Letter impact the applicability of Benefit A and its Waiting Period?
What documentation or proof is required to confirm the Maid’s diagnosis of one of the five Critical Illnesses under Benefit B, and how does this affect the claims process?

In cases where the Maid is diagnosed with a Critical Illness but the diagnosis is not unequivocal or is made by a non-Registered Medical Practitioner, how does this affect the eligibility for Benefit B?
How does the increased Annual Sub-Limit under Benefit A interact with the Basic Plan Type coverage limits and any existing co-payment obligations?
If the Maid is diagnosed with a Critical Illness during the Period of Insurance but does not survive the 30-day survival period, what is the impact on the Benefit B payout?
How does the policy handle claims for hospital and surgical expenses if Benefit A was not included at the Policy Effective Date but added later with a Waiting Period?
What are the conditions under which the Benefit Limit specified in the Policy Schedule applies to both Benefit A and Benefit B, and how do these limits interact?
How does the policy define the Period of Insurance in relation to the timing of diagnosis for Critical Illness under Benefit B, and what are the implications for coverage?
In the event of a claim under Benefit A, how is the 25% co-payment calculated and applied, and does it affect the increased Annual Sub-Limit or the total hospital surgical expenses?
How do the requirements for a Registered Medical Practitioner’s diagnosis and the 30-day survival period under Benefit B ensure the validity of a Critical Illness claim?
What happens if the Maid’s hospital or surgical expenses occur during the 30-day Waiting Period after Benefit A is added post-Effective Date—are these expenses covered or excluded?
